question: 回転
sourceMnemonic: You <kanji>revolve</kanji> X number of <kanji>times</kanji>. Really, the times isn't so important, but the revolving is. That's why this word is <vocabulary>revolve</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>rotate</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. P.S. Ever heard of "<ja>回転ずし</ja>?" That's the kind of sushi that's on conveyer belts, rotating around and around, bringing you delicious plates of things.
